app.Army module¶

class app.Army.Army(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Armies consists of squads.

Attributes:
get_squads: It represents the squads list.
attack(army, strategy)[source]¶

The attack success probability of a squad is determined as the arithmetic average of the attack success probability squads.

Args:
army: Army. strategy: Strategy of squad choice.
get_health()[source]¶

It represents the sum of squads’ health.

Returns:
Armies health.
get_name()[source]¶

It represents the army’s name.

Returns:
Army’s name.
get_squads¶
static take_damage(damage, strategy_name, army)[source]¶

A choice of a squad according to a strategy and causing damage.

Args:
damage: Damage, the soldiers will receive. strategy_name: A name of a strategy. army: Army.

app.BattleField module¶

class app.BattleField.BattleField(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Armies are created and fight here. And the winner is determined.

start()[source]¶

Armies are created and a battle takes place. And the winner is determined.

Returns:
The name of the victorious army.

app.Squad module¶

class app.Squad.Squad(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Squads are consisted out of a number of units (soldiers or vehicles), that behave as a coherent group. A squad is active as long as is contains an active unit.

Attributes:
get_experience: It represents the sum of soldiers’ experience. get_health: It represents the sum of units’ health. do_attack: The attack success probability of a squad is determined as the arithmetic average of the attack success probability of each member.
do_attack¶
get_experience¶
get_health¶
take_damage(damage)[source]¶

Calculation the damage amount of a squad. The damage received on a successful attack is distributed evenly to all squad members.

Args:
damage: Damage, the squad will receive.

app.Units module¶

class app.Units.Solder[source]¶

Bases: app.Units.Unit

Soldiers are units whose additional property is experience.

This class calculates probability of soldiers’ attack success and the complete damage.

Attributes:
get_experience: It represents the soldiers’ experience. do_attack: It calculates a probability of soldiers’ attack success. It increases soldiers’ experience. It returns soldiers’ attack.
do_attack¶
get_experience¶
set_experience()[source]¶

Set experience of a Soldier. Maximum of 50.

take_damage(damage)[source]¶

Calculation the damage amount of a soldier and reducing the soldier’s health.

Args:
damage: Damage, the soldiers will receive.
class app.Units.Unit[source]¶

Bases: object

Each unit represents either a soldier or a vehicle maned by a predetermined number of soldiers.

Attributes:
prev_time: Time of the previous attack. get_health: Represents the health of the unit. get_recharge: Represents the number of ms required to recharge the unit for an attack. get_experience: Represents the soldier’s experience. do_attack: It calculates a probability of units’ attack success. It increases soldiers’ experience and reduces health. It returns soldiers’ attack.
check_attack()[source]¶

Checking for the possibility of committing the attack. It compares the current time and the next attack time.

Returns:
It returns True if the attack is possible or False if recharging has not passed yet.

get_experience¶

get_recharge¶
prev_time = None¶

Set recharge of Units.

Args:
recharge: The recharge of the unit.
take_damage(damage)[source]¶
class app.Units.Vehicles[source]¶

Bases: app.Units.Unit

Vehicles are units whose additional property is operators quantity.

This class calculates probability of vehicles attack success and the complete damage.

Attributes:
operators: It represents the operators list. get_experience: It represents the sum of soldiers’ experience. do_attack: It calculates a probability of vehicles’ attack success. It returns vehicles’ attack.
static alive(units)[source]¶

It shows are there at least one soldier alive.

Args:
units: The list of soldiers.
Returns:
True if at least one soldier alive otherwise False.
do_attack¶
get_experience¶
get_operators()[source]¶
operators = []¶
take_damage(damage)[source]¶

Calculation the damage amount of a vehicle and reducing the vehicle and soldiers health. 60% of damage will receive a vehicle, 20 % of damage will receive a random operator and the remaining will receive 10%.

Args:
damage: Damage, the vehicles will receive.
